Comments_List: probability
Probability theory.
Insight: will never take a class again with Yihong
statistical thinking.
Many basic concepts and some knowledge in statistics
Fundamental prob theory.
This course covers not only some basic knowledge of probability theory but also some inspiration of monte carlo methods. The random walk question is my favourite  part.
Knowledge about probability, some linkage to other domains in statistics
Many examples about the probability theory.
Doing integrals and the idea of random walk
Statistical calculation.
Probability
How to calculate mean, standard deviation, variance. Distributions of continuous and discrete random numbers. Developed a statistical analysis mindset.
probability theory and application.
Probability therory
Command basic probability theory.

Probability reasoning
Knowledge of integration
Random work problem, very interesting
The convolution is very important, which I didnt learn in my undergraduate probability course
I developed a better mathematical intuition about problems that occur in everyday life, as well as notations for technical explanations of those problems and probabilities.

I did learn the basics of probability that we need to succeed in courses such as Linear Models--sure.  
But I also learned important survival skills:  the ability to survive a course when all the TFs and course instructor are incompetent in their own unique way.
Some intuition about probability
Understanding probability theories, solving relevant problems
Basic probability theories and applications
I learned to calculate probability.
Understanding basic theory of probability. I was able to obtain new perspective of viewing events with quantitative aspects. Able to increase my understanding of probability
Theoretical knowledge about probability
basic, comprehensive probability knowledge

I came to understand what the knowledge structure for a probability course is, and how probability is relevant to our daily lives. I came to realize probability is a very useful tool in approaching a lot of problems.
very good

Strengths: very challenging and useful
weaknesses: a little bit too challenging for most of the graduate students who learnt calculus about four years ago?
There should definitely be a discussion session for students to discuss homework and extra exercise questions.

Weakness: piss poor delivery and explanation from the instructor, complete lack of concern for the actual learning of his students

Improvement: have another professor teach the course

Strength: provide lecture.
Weaknesses: study resource is not enough. Suggest increase more office hour and help students solve homework questions.

Strength: Slides are very clear and posted in time
Weakness: Too many people in this course and not enough professional office hour so that we can get only very limited help during the office hour

most of the students, including myself, were confused all the time, and office hours were not helpful at all. My suggestion would be scheduling one of the office hours as a review session to go over the material and make sure all students are able to follow. I had to spend so many hours just trying to understand course material by myself and most of the time I felt like I was wasting my time. 
Course has lots of office hours and teaching assistants but the goal should be how to assign them in a most effective way. If OHs are not useful there is no point of scheduling them at all.
Instructor is so tough.

The strength is that the course covers a lot of material. However, most of my time is focus on understand the theory but have no time to do some practice. Also I think the final examination is too difficult.
The homework is hard for seemingly no reason.

Strengths: We get to practice our skills and strengthen our understanding of the materials through pretty difficult home work.  

Weakness: The instructor mainly read through the slides during lectures. I think a probability course could use the blackboard more. Also, the TA led discussion session is useless. The final exam is beyond what we have learnt in the course. I feel like i need more lectures or discussion sessions from the professor.
The final exam is far too difficult!
The homework sets are intense and time-consuming while worth trying. There seems to be a gap between what was taught in class and homework and the final exam.
The class material is easy but the exam is too hard.
test is harder than before
I was frustrated and overwhelmed by the homework and exams. Put in a lot of time but didn't get as good result as I expected....
The materials are hard

Strength: the material of course is very helpful. The contents are designed and selected in a good way. Slides are easy to understand 

Weakness: too many jumps in math reasoning. Final exam is not consistent with the stress of homework

I had difficulties with correlating what was learned in class to what knowledge I needed to complete the weekly problem sets. I think the language/accent barrier with the professor and TAs added to communication difficulties, but overall they seemed to be trying their best to teach, it just didn't click well with me as a student. I found it much more productive to read the textbook to figure out the homework than to try to follow notes from lecture.

Nicer and more approachable professor.  Exams with basic doable questions.  The level of difficulty between Yihong and other professors' exams are vastly different.  Exams from Yihong are easily 10x times more difficult.

The course teaches important material but doesnt prepare you for it. The material is very dense and there is no adequate preparation in class. Even after studying the lecture materials and reading the textbooks, the homework is still very hard to do, and sometimes even the TF doesnt know how.

The course materials are very clearly organized, which is great. I wish the instructor could understand us students better as we are not experts in this area, and we sometimes do not understand certain ideas which might be obvious to him. The final exam is so hard that most of us feel desperate after taking it.
The class after midterm is too difficult to understand for a student majored in MPH.

Strength: The course is rigorous and prepares student with important concepts of probability. Moreover, it teaches very essential ideas that are related to other important statistics courses.

Weakness: Due to amount of material covered, course lacks focus and there are way too much materials that could be daunting. Unlike other courses, it requires understanding of many inter related concepts. can be a challenge to some students
The lecture could have more examples of the types of problems that each theory or concept can apply to
I could develop knowledge about probability theory

strength: ppt is clear
weakness: class too early

Strengths: the instructor knows what he is doing. The slides are organized and well prepared, and most topics for probability were addressed in this class. 
Weaknesses: it is fair to assume previous knowledge for this class, but it seems that the instructor expects students to possess a high level of mathematical knowledge and sense, which, sadly, some students didn't really have. The course starts with a very accessible pace, and then the level of difficulty suddenly rises, and culminates in something that I was totally lost in the last few lectures. The proof was mentioned very tersely in the class, with jumps in steps, so it was very hard for students to follow. Overall, probability is a hard class, with arcane materials and abstract concepts that take some time to chew and absorb, but I feel that the class didn't help me organize and understand the knowledge well. I need to read the textbook to get a coherent picture of what's going on and how relevant concepts could tie together. The homework takes too much time to do, with a level of difficulty that surpasses what was taught in class. It is a good try, but I wish the instructor could include more examples with a comparable difficulty of the homework. The final exam was a disaster. I feel that what was tested had little overlap of what I reviewed. It passed beyond "basic concepts" (i.e. points that could be easily gained) and tested on advanced topics such as convolution.
yes
NO.
you better find some other electives unless this is a required course for you
No. So tough. The instructor take too much expectation.
No. The coursework is far more challenging than it actually needs to be, and the professor is too brilliant to be helpful at actually teaching
Yes, probability is interesting. The design of this course teaches more applying side of probability.
I would not recommend this course to others unless he or she has a strong math background.
I would recommend it to other student if he/she is very interested in probability and likes challenges. Also, he/she is expected to have a great mastery of calculus.
Yes. This is a great course since it not only includes the theory of probability but also its applications.
yes

This is a hard course but I still recommend it because probability theory is fundamental for STEM students. Prof. Wu expended the knowledge in homework so it is very tricky and challenging. I learnt a lot in a hard way. Be prepared to spend lots of time for this course.
Yes hard but useful class
Yes. This course is very useful, stressing on the application rather than proof of theorem. Instructor teaches clearly.
It would depend on the student, if they seemed like they would work well with this professor and material I would suggest it. To most students I would not recommend.

Yes if Yihong is NOT teaching it.  No if he is teaching it.  
I would not even wish my greatest enemies the suffering my friends and I endured from him and this course.
No, unless the course is more organized or maybe taught by another professor. The level of difficulty between this year and last year is ridiculous.
Yes. Although it is a hard course, it is necessary to take probability theory to explore further in this area.

The course is a core subject for Statistics for a reason. It introduces students to very important concepts and ideas that are integral to their understanding of statistics and data science. If a student is interested in these fields, I absolutely recommend them to take it because the course can teach alot.
Yes I think this class provides a strong foundation in probabilistic thinking
Yes!
yes, a good intro to prob

If this is your required class, then I guess you don't have a choice. 

But if you just want to take it for fun, think twice. This is a very challenging class that requires a high level of math ability. If you lack the background knowledge, you won't be able to follow along and that may be very painful.
